name: Sean M
text:
Korean food is usually around $10-$20 a dish no matter where you are. Seoul BBQ is no anomaly, maybe just a little more expensive than usual, but there are some decent lunch specials.

To the food: I got kimchi jjigae (spelled "kimchi chigae" at Seoul BBQ probably for pronunciation ease), a spicy stew of cabbage, beef, tofu, and noodles. It was spicy and hearty, great for the 30 degree weather tonight. The banchan (side dishes served with all the main dishes) was delicious. If it looks weird and you haven't tried it, try it.

Make sure to ask for the barley tea along with whatever else you have to drink. It comes with your food, just like water, and really complements the Korean flavors.

name: Allison Marchant
text: We love eating here! My husband was deployed to South Korea when he was in the Army. He enjoys it because it is the closest to authentic he has found. I enjoy trying different types of food and they have some very delicious food! Sadly I have heard that they will be closing some time soon. I'm hoping they will open in another location after. We will go there as long as they are open.

name: Steven Einhorn
text:
Downtown Auburn.
Parking hard.
Food excellent and authentic.
Good selection on menu.
Pricing moderate.
Service attentive.

name: Nicholas Blair
text: I got the beef bugogi lunch special which was pretty bland, but others in it group got specials that looked fantastic. I enjoyed the service and atmosphere so I'll go ahead and give five stars.

name: Sarah Arthurs
text: Delicious kimchi! Some of the best Korean in town.

name: Rob Szarka
text: I ate here twice on a recent trip to Auburn and the food was excellent both times.

name: Junshan Liu
text: A nice place for a quick lunch at downtown Auburn.

name: Stephen Shields
text: Amazing food at a decent price, very authentic. Korean food.

name: Hongyan Tian
text:
(Translated by Google) Close to school, taste is okay, personally like green house

(Original)
靠近学校，口味还可以，个人喜欢绿房子
